snp4.3:1.2: while others speak set on truth.
snp4.3:1.3: When disputes come up a sage does not get involved,
snp4.3:1.4: which is why they’ve no barrenness at all.
snp4.3:2.1: How can you transcend your own view
snp4.3:2.2: when you’re led by preference, dogmatic in belief?
snp4.3:2.4: you’d speak according to your notion.
snp4.3:3.2: of their own precepts and vows.
snp4.3:3.3: They have an ignoble nature, say the experts,
snp4.3:3.4: since they speak on themselves of their own accord.
snp4.3:4.2: never boasts “thus am I” of their precepts.
snp4.3:4.3: They have a noble nature, say the experts,
snp4.3:4.4: not proud of anything in the world.
snp4.3:5.1: For one who formulates and creates teachings,
snp4.3:5.2: and promotes them despite their defects,
snp4.3:5.3: if they see an advantage for themselves,
snp4.3:5.4: they become dependent on that, <j>relying on unstable peace.
snp4.3:6.1: It’s not easy to get over dogmatic views
snp4.3:6.2: adopted after judging among the teachings.
snp4.3:6.3: That’s why, among all these dogmas, a person
snp4.3:6.4: rejects one teaching and takes up another.
snp4.3:7.1: The cleansed one has no formulated view
snp4.3:7.2: at all in the world about the different realms.
snp4.3:7.3: Having given up illusion and conceit,
snp4.3:7.4: by what path would they go? They are not involved.
snp4.3:8.1: For one who is involved <j>gets embroiled in disputes about teachings—
snp4.3:8.2: but how to dispute with the uninvolved? <j>About what?
snp4.3:8.3: For picking up and putting down <j>is not what they do;
snp4.3:8.4: they have shaken off all views in this very life.
